datafield.subfield: Observation of $D^0 \to \rho^0\gamma$ and Search for $CP$ Violation in Radiative Charm Decays

We report the first observation of the radiative charm decay $D^{0}→ρ^{0}γ$ and the first search for CP violation in decays $D^{0}→ρ^{0}γ$, ϕγ, and $\bar{K}$*0(892)γ, using a data sample of 943 fb$^{−1}$ collected with the Belle detector at the KEKB asymmetric-energy $e^{+}e^−$ collider. The branching fraction is measured to be B($D^{0}→ρ^{0}γ$)=(1.77±0.30±0.07)×10$^{−5}$, where the first uncertainty is statistical and the second is systematic. The obtained CP asymmetries A$_{CP}$($D^{0}→ρ^{0}γ$)=+0.056±0.152±0.006, A$_{CP}$($D^{0}→ρ^{0}γ$) =− 0.094±0.066±0.001, and A$_{CP}$($D^{0}→\bar{K}*^{0}$γ)=−0.003±0.020±0.000 are consistent with no CP violation. We also present an improved measurement of the branching fractions B($D^{0}→ρ^{0}γ$)=(2.76±0.19±0.10)×10$^{−5}$ and B($D^{0}→\bar{K}*^{0}$γ)=(4.66±0.21±0.21)×10$^{−4}$.
